reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were sent here by Hotel Raquel where we originally wanted to stay. Hotel Raquel told us they were having problems with their renos.
reviews.title: Terrible staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first port of call in Cuba for a 2 week holiday. We stayed in three hotels in Havana and loved the Santa Isabel.
reviews.title: Great start to a holiday

reviews.text: The location is great, right in the old town on a plaza with the sea in sight so it's easy to orientate yourself really quickly.
reviews.title: Great location but give the restaurant a miss ! ! !
loved santa isabel
reviews.text: the best part of the stay was the breakfast which is served a la carte - a true luxury compared to many other places in Cuba and it was a really good standard. Something we only appreciated fully after staying at other places.

The rooms are large and cool. We had a huge balcony overlooking the square which was great for chilling out on with a beer.I was even amazed that the mini bar had items charged at shop prices (eg 1cuc for water) as coming from the UK I'm used to hotels inflating mini bar prices by 10 times.
reviews.title: Not my first choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had no problems with the staff here, they were all helpful whenever we needed to ask them anything.
reviews.title: Bit of a disappointment

likes.disliked: — Not what I expected from one of Havana's
